Posts.Content: sharonlouise wrote: anyone take wellbutrin during chemo, and what chemo did you take? my onc says wait but it seems like i've read other women taking it during chemo??? would like to start now, my life is a train wreck.....  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sharonlouise wrote: Hi all, I had surg. december 11 & just had a Lupron shot this wed (to possibly protect ovaries), which supposedly takes 2 weeks to kick in. Which means chemo like March 4th or so. anyone do chemo this far from surg? freaking out!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: is my chemo too far from surgery?? sharonlouise sharonlouise

Posts.Content: sharonlouise wrote: Hi, diagnosed IDC 3 weeks ago (& my treament's still up in the air) & it really just hit me. anyway. was going thru a separation from my husband when I got the diagnosis, my father's dead/my mother's mentally ill, so don't have the standard parental units. My sister's across the country from me and unbelievably was also just diagnosed with breast cancer (DCIS). A friend was going to come out to stay with me, i was so happy about that, but she can't now. i feel so alone I can't stand it, can't sleep, can't stop crying, can't believe this is happening and I'm supposed to speak to my surgeon first thing tomorrow morning. Anyway, just thought I'd vent. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: completely freaking sharonlouise TerryNY

Posts.Content: sharonlouise wrote: Hi all, I'm 39 years old, 3 weeks out of a bilateral (my sister was diagnosed the same week--DCIS!) and will be seeing an oncologist next week. My DX: idc, lump about 1.75 cm, no node involvement. ER + & P +, HER2-. not doing rads. was wondering if there's anyone out there with a similar DX--am curious what you were recommended, chemo-wise? many thx! ---sharon  Log in to post a reply
